result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ozie A Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ozie A Peterson in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 15CT319 and 15CT580, Court grants the State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ozie A Peterson in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has just received all four cases with a county TR case she is not appointed on. Defense addresses the defendant's license. Defense requests 30 days for tentative plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.

Defendant Ozie A Peterson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Court will give another date in 2 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ozie A Peterson in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. Court will give a date in two weeks.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED A $100.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid DL.
COURT ORDERED A $100.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle

Defendant Ozie A Peterson in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Criminal complaint addressed. Court finds probable cause. Reading waived by defendant. Not guilty plea entered by the Court. Court sets bail w/conditions. Court will give another date.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
